qas.question: Much of the material in the Canon is not specifically what?
Who may have added texts to the Canon for some time?

context: Much of the material in the Canon is not specifically "<a0_0>Theravadin<a0_0/>", but is instead the collection of teachings that this school preserved from the early, non-sectarian body of teachings. According to Peter Harvey, it contains material at odds with later Theravadin orthodoxy. He states: "<a1_0>The Theravadins<a1_0/>, then, may have added texts to the Canon for some time, but they do not appear to have tampered with what they already had from an earlier period."
